Company Name: Southern Farm Bureau Life Insurance Co.
Job Description:
The Data Engineer is responsible for development and support for SFBLI’s enterprise data warehouse (EDW). This position will utilize various methods and technology to transform raw data into useful data systems. The Data Engineer will create and maintain all ETL processes for the EDW along with providing operational support in production. The Data Engineer will also work with business areas to help design and load data marts/data sets as needed.



Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree (Math, Computer Science, Information Systems, Statistics Preferred) or a combination of education and experience
Graduate Degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Information Systems, Data Science preferred
Minimum of 2 years of experience in data engineering or comparable programming/design experience
Experience working at Southern Farm Bureau Life in a role requiring an understanding of the underlying data for various SFB systems preferred.
Experience with ETL process, database design and deploying/supporting in a production environment
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal data and processes to answer specific business issues and identify opportunities for improvement
The ability to establish measurable outcomes and create processes for monitoring progress towards established goals.
The ability to make well-informed, effective and timely decisions, even when data is limited or solutions produce unpleasant consequences; perceive the impact and implications of decisions.
Responsibilities
Builds, enhances, and scales out infrastructure to ingest, process and extract meaning from data
Collaborates with analytics and business teams to improve data models that feed business intelligence tools, increasing data accessibility and fostering data-driven decision making across the organization
Implements policies and procedures that ensure production database-related issues (EDW) are handled in a timely manner
Evaluates new data development, ensuring consistency and providing for integration with existing warehouse structure.
Identifies opportunities for process improvement and additional data sources throughout the company
Assures compliance with regulatory requirements governing privacy, data collection, and reporting
Assures that all data processes adhere to the Data Governance guidelines



At Southern Farm Bureau Life Insurance Company, our Mission is to be the life insurance company of choice for our Farm Bureau family. Our focus is to provide competitive products and superior customer service to our Farm Bureau policyholders and agents, while observing the highest ethical standards. Southern Farm Bureau Life Insurance Company continues to build on over 75 years of success with an outlined strategic vision, defined core values and above all, our employees. Our Company strives to provide a workplace with an outstanding culture, focusing on the development, growth and engagement of its employees.

We are looking for candidates who model our Company’s Core Values which are:

COMMITMENT TO SERVICE - recognizes that serving our agents, policyholders, and employees is the foundation of our success
RESPECT FOR PEOPLE - values individual’s unique talents, backgrounds, and experiences
INTEGRITY- upholds the highest ethical standards in all of their actions
ACCOUNTABILITY FOR RESULTS - commits to getting the job done by taking ownership of their work
COMMITMENT TO TEAMWORK - understands, appreciates, and respects each individual's roles on their teams
COURAGE TO ACT - acts in the best interest of the Company

Position Description:
Provide first level of field engineering support to operational and technical support teams for Field Engineering and Company’s Information Systems and System Users. Monitor, maintain and support all networked computers, printers and associated operating systems and service applications (gaming and nongaming.) Responsible for ensuring the stability and integrity of all in-house computer and server hardware, software, voice, data, video, wired and wireless network services, including Local Area Network (LAN) services, connectivity; to include low voltage services, and works closely with senior field engineers to provide exceptional customer service.



Provide first level of technical support by performing basic and advanced incident troubleshooting and tracking and assist with problem resolution, fault isolation, follow-up support and documentation to include providing action reports to department team leaders
Responds to computer, network or data security vulnerability alerts at the property and regional levels for high priority outage restoration efforts
Provide installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, and optimization of all computer hardware and software within property data centers and communications closets or where Information Technology assets are contained in a training or production environment
Perform remedial maintenance on basic network devices, computer hardware and software, including the restoration of configurations with assistance from senior and second level field engineers and IT Operations Center engineers or in combined resolution efforts with vendor support engineers or technicians
Analyze and resolve computer and printer hardware and software problems in an efficient and accurate manner following all safety and security precautions
Provide setup and teardown services for local, regional and national performing acts. This includes load in, load out, and set construction.
Operation and troubleshooting of computerized lighting systems for stage and industrial areas. Create and control lighting for local and regional acts.
Configuration, programming, and maintenance of high-end sound equipment including mixing boards, amplifiers, audio processors, wired and wireless mic systems. Providing both front and back of house support and operation of these systems during performances.
Install and troubleshoot digital signage systems including both indoor and outdoor displays, video walls, projectors, monument and
pylon signs. Familiarity with VGA, DVI, HDMI, and Multicast preferred.
Perform moves/adds/changes on traditional, digital, and IP based phone and voicemail systems. Basic understanding of PRI, ISDN, POTS and IP based communication technology preferred.
Provide scheduled on-call support for after-hours support issues and resolution
Perform inventory of Company assets and document stock levels for department visibility
Record, monitor, track, and document work performed using the Company’s tracking system
Provide Smart Device activation and enrollment into Company’s Mobile Device Management System and provide initial user training
Provide support for Company’s Marketing Media Content Delivery Systems
Other duties, as assigned
In-collaboration with and under guidance of Corporate IT functional teams:
Participate in disaster recovery testing
Participate in functional and empirical analysis related to the design, development, planning, and configuration of computer and peripheral hardware
Participate in rollouts of new computer and software upgrades
Perform advanced desktop engineering functions, including computer imaging, setup and deployment in the field environment
Provide user training and support using Company configuration management tools and applications
Assist in determining product compatibility, flexibility, and recommends replacement, upgrade or retirement of Company assets during assigned duties



Position Requirements:
Requires being able to obtain a MS Gaming Badge

Description:

RKF Engineering specializes in the design of next generation communication systems and software for today’s most advanced satellite and terrestrial communication networks. Based in Bethesda MD, RKF is seeking exceptional software and communications developers to work in a dynamic team environment on an array of challenging problems. Our firm is always seeking experienced and innovative individuals who are looking for an exciting challenge.

RKF Engineering LLC provides electromagnetic environmental effects (E3) analysis support to the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) and the Defense Spectrum Organization (DSO) Joint Spectrum Center (JSC) in accordance with the Telecommunications Act of 1996.

Under this directive all Federal government departments and agencies are directed to provide access to mobile service providers (MSP) for the installation and operation of cellular telecommunications systems on military bases in the United States.

This project supports the JSC by determining whether the operation of proposed MSP cellular transmission systems will interfere with government and Department of Defense (DoD) communications-electronic systems. The position requires knowledge of basic or advanced communications systems theory, database management, and communications-electronics (C-E) design and functionality. Some familiarity with domestic regulations governing the use of the radio frequency spectrum is desirable

As an RF Interference Engineer the hired individual will report to the MSP Project Manager. The responsibilities of the job include, but are not limited to:

Performing electromagnetic compatibility analyses to determine if new MSP installations can operate compatibly in a specific geographical area without posing conflicts to nearby DoD C-E systems operations. When interference is predicted the engineer will develop methods to mitigate predicted electromagnetic interference issues (EMI).
Perform the above tasks and document the progress and results of the analysis according to RKF and JSC report guidelines within the scheduled time period and allocated budget of each task.
The principal qualifications and abilities needed for this position include:

o Ability to discuss and understand the technical design and operation of wireless RF (telecommunications and cellular communications) systems and the operation of wireless DoD C-E receiver systems.

o Perform sub-database searches of technical records for government C-E systems from DoD and government master frequency databases

o Familiarity with basic radio frequency propagation equations and the operation principles of transmitters and antennas

o Perform linear and intermodulation E3 compatibility predictions using computer propagation models.

Depending on the level of experience, on-the job training will be provided to fulfill the above requirements.

Requirements:

Qualifications: Applicant must have the following minimum education:

A Bachelors in Electrical Engineering, Physics, or Mathematics.
4 years experience and training in the engineering and design of cellular communications systems and other RF systems is desirable.
DOD software development experience and computer programming is a plus.
Additional Preferred Qualifications:
-Prior military service in the field of Spectrum management and DoD systems operation,
-Experience working in the DoD and US military spectrum community to design communication networks,
-Experience working in the commercial telecommunications industry, especially cellular systems,
Knowledge of DoD spectrum management process and procedures; knowledge regarding use
of DoD spectrum management tools (e.g., Spectrum XXI)
-A Masters in Electrical Engineering, Physics or Mathematics. Experience with designing and
running complex analysis tools, data management skills, and ability to work in a collaborative,
team-based environment are also desirable.

Security Clearance - Active Secret clearance or the candidate to be able to obtain a SECRET level security clearance. In order to obtain a clearance you need to be a US Citizen and show proof of citizenship.

RKF Engineering LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state or local law.

Job Title: Senior System Integration Engineer C4iSR and C5iSR
Job Description:
The Senior System Integration Engineer specializing in Command, Control, Communication, Computers, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (C4iSR) and Command, Control, Communication, Computers, Cyber, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (C5iSR) is responsible for designing, implementing, and integrating complex systems and solutions within the defense and intelligence domain.

Responsibilities

· Lead the design, integration, and testing of C4iSR and C5iSR systems and solutions.

· Develop system architecture requirements and specification based on customer needs and industry standards.

· Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software developers, system engineers and project managers to ensure successful system integration.

· Conduct system analysis and performance assessment to identify areas for improvement and optimize system functionality.

· Identify and mitigate technical risk and issues during system integration and deployment.

· Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior engineers and team members.

· Stay up to date with emerging technologies and trends in the C4iSR and C5iSR domain.

· Ensure compliance with relevant industry standards, security protocols, and regulatory requirements.

· Prepare and present technical reports documentation and presentation to internal and external stakeholders.

· Other tasks assigned by HgP.

Requirements

· Active Top-Secret Clearance

· Degree in Engineering and experience in system integration

· Minimum of 8 years of experience in system integration preferably in the defense and intelligence domain.

· Proficient in system integration tools and methodologies.

· Experience with system engineering processes including requirements analysis, system design, integration, testing and documentation.

· Strong Operational and Engineering background that fully understands the connectivity required (i.e., how C2 system interacts) with and within the operational kill chain of airborne threats.

· Strong candidates possess some experience and relevant knowledge and understanding of operating in the NATO/ USAFE/ EUCOM environment.

· Have the right contacts (e.g know the right JICO to work with) in the European environment.

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues.

· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross functional teams and customers.

· Must be willing to travel internationally if needed.

· Strong leadership and team management skills.

· Should be able to lead projects & team.

Location

CUNOS/ OCUNOS.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $99,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance

Compensation package:

Performance bonus

Experience level:

8 years

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Experience:

System Integration for C4iSR and C5iSR: 8 years (Required)

Security clearance:

Top Secret (Required)

Work Location: On the road

Responsibilities:
The Quality Assurance Engineer provides technical support for various quality system processes to help ensure excellent product quality throughout product lifecycles.
Position Responsibilities: Drive continuous improvement actions focused on product quality. Works with Engineering and Manufacturing to develop acceptance criteria for production processes.
Works with Service and the Complaint Handling Unit to investigate product problems, perform root cause analysis and identify possible corrective actions.
Analyzes production quality data to identify trends or issues which require action or CAPA activity.
Assists in creating and implementing procedures in the quality management system.
Assists in the review and disposition of nonconforming materials. Assists in the creation and validation of manufacturing processes.
Conducts internal audits of production processes and report results. Reviews manufacturing process and part deviations.
Creates quality alerts when acceptance activities need to be adjusted.
Supports external regulator or customer audits Provides response to inquiries related to quality assurance arising from tenders or other sales efforts.
Performs other duties as requested.
Requirements:
Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering or related field. 3+ years relevant work experience.
Demonstrated ability to analyze, evaluate and control risk following lifecycle risk management standards (e.g. ISO 14971).
Experience with manufacturing/quality methodologies such as QFD, six-sigma, lean, etc. Understanding of statistical analysis techniques and tools. Experience with formal quality systems such as ISO 13485 or ISO 9001 and or CFR 210 & 211.
ASQ or related quality certification is preferred.
Work experience in a FDA regulated environment is preferred.
Proficiency in reading and understanding technical product documentation (diagrams, schematics, flow-charts, etc.)
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office tools such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc. Comfortable with using PC tools and Windows OS, with a working knowledge of local and network based file systems.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills using the English language. Able to coordinate multiple activities and actions of persons contributing to assigned tasks.
Detail oriented with good organizational and record keeping skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Proactive and timely in execution of assigned tasks.
Able to be flexible and adaptable when needs and priorities change Physical demands and work environment:
